ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Basic solid state physics, including lattice structure, phonon, band structure and semiconductor physics.
Heavy on mathematics, gain a lot of physical insights and problem solving skills.
Essental semiconductor knowledges, reciprocal space and relation to x-ray scattering, light matter interactions
Better understanding about band theory and semiconductors.
Quite a lot, hard to account!
I have gained some insights about cutting-edge technologies about experimental condensed matter physics and materials science, as well as basic knowledge for solid state physcis.
Basic knowledge about crystal structure, phonon and band structure, which can be very useful in my future research in electrical engineering.
I learned how we can predict macroscopic-level properties by using microscopic interactions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Useful class and very well taught.
Problem sets are difficult, might be better to give more hints.
Strength: very engaging, detailed, and insightful lecture. instructor has strong communication abilities

The strength is to help student understand material. The weakness is that, as a huge field with long history, this course cannot bridge the knowledge with ongoing progress seamlessly. Overall our professor is doing very well.
I think for some part, the professor's speed is too fast.
Generally it is very good, I learnt a lot. If possible, I hope the exams and assignments can be easier in the future since they were too challenging for people  not from a physics background like me.
The course pace was a bit fast for me. It would have been better if there had been more lecture hours per week or the curriculum had been narrowed down a bit.
Strengths lessons weaknesses problem sets. PSet material couldve been covered more in class
There are quite a lot of homework for students to get practice.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Very interesting class to me, but might be difficult.
Yes, I think this is very good start point for condensed matter physics. A little bit of material science basics will be helpful to most of the students working in physics or engineering.
Highly recommend! Well explained physics
I would recommend this course who wants to learn basic principles of condensed matter physics.
Yes. Very useful for people in related field.
Yes, even if this is a difficult course, it is a lesson from which many concepts can be learned.
Yes
Well if you want to learn the solid state physics, I believe this course is a must.
